00040 /**
00041  * Error handling and assignment. Takes in errors for specific identifiers and
00042  * stores them in groups. This way a single form element, for example, can display
00043  * multiple errors with it's input.
00044  *
00045  * @category   Colony
00046  * @package    Bee
00047  * @copyright  Copyright (c) Army of Bees (www.armyofbees.com)
00048  * @license    http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php MIT License
00049  */
00050 class Bee_Error 
00051 {
00052     /**
00053      * Errors stored by this error handler
00054      * @var array
00055      */
00056     private static $_errors = array();
00057     
00058     /**
00059      * Controller reference
00060      * @var Bee_Controller 
00061      */
00062     protected $_controller = null;
00063 
00064     /** 
00065      * Constructor
00066      *
00067      * @param array $controller The referenced controller
00068      */
00069     public function __construct( &$controller )
00070     {
00071         $this->_controller =& $controller;
00072         
00073         // Load errors from the session object
00074         $sess =& Bee_Registry('sess');
00075         if( isset( $sess['Bee_Error'] ) )
00076         {
00077             self::$_errors = $sess['Bee_Error'];
00078             
00079             // Clear the session data for subsequent page loads
00080             unset( $sess['Bee_Error'] );
00081         }
00082     }
00083 
00084     /**
00085      * Adds an error for the user to a group
00086      * 
00087      * @param string $id The identifier of this group of errors
00088      * @param string $message The error message
00089      */ 
00090     public function add( $id, $message )
00091     {
00092         if( !isset( self::$_errors[$id] ) )
00093             self::$_errors[$id] = array();
00094             
00095         self::$_errors[$id][] = $message;
00096     }
00097     
00098     /**
00099      * Looks up the errors in a group by ID
00100      * 
00101      * @param string $id The identifier of this error
00102      * @return array Collection of error messages
00103      */ 
00104     public function lookup( $id )
00105     {
00106         return self::$_errors[$id];
00107     }
00108     
00109     /**
00110      * Looks up the errors in a group by ID
00111      * 
00112      * @param string $id The identifier of this error
00113      * @return array Collection of error messages
00114      */ 
00115     public function getAll()
00116     {
00117         return self::$_errors;
00118     }
00119     
00120     /**
00121      * Sends the browser to the page with errors, passed via session
00122      * 
00123      * @param string $location Where to send the user if there are errors
00124      */ 
00125     public function trap( $location )
00126     {
00127         if( count( self::$_errors ) > 0 )
00128         {
00129             // Store the errors into the session for the following page load and redirect
00130             $sess =& Bee_Registry('sess');
00131             $sess['Bee_Error'] = self::$_errors;
00132             $this->_controller->redirect( $location );
00133         }
00134     }
00135     
00136     /**
00137      * Smarty function to format errors for easy reference in templates. 
00138      * Uses erroritem.tpl, if available.
00139      *
00140      * Takes in a "id" parameter with the ID of the error group to return. 
00141      * If "id" is empty or undefied, all errors are returned.
00142      * 
00143      * @param string $params Parameters passed to the Smarty function
00144      * @param Smarty $smarty Reference to the Smarty object calling this function
00145      */ 
00146     public static function formatError( $params, &$smarty )
00147     {
00148         if( empty( $params['id'] ) )
00149         {
00150             $errors = array();
00151             foreach( self::$_errors as $errorgroup )
00152                 foreach( $errorgroup as $err )
00153                     $errors[] = $err;
00154         }
00155         else
00156         {
00157             if( !empty( self::$_errors[$params['id']] ) )
00158                 $errors = self::$_errors[$params['id']];
00159             else
00160                 $errors = array();
00161         }
00162         
00163         $smarty->assign( array( 'erroritems' => $errors ) );
00164 
00165         if( file_exists( 'app/views/erroritem.tpl' ) )
00166             return $smarty->fetch( 'erroritem.tpl' );
00167         else
00168         {
00169             $output = "<ul>\n";
00170             foreach( $errors as $err )
00171                 $output .= "<li>$err</li>\n";
00172             $output .= "</ul>";
00173             
00174             return $output;
00175         }
00176     }
00177 }
